contentrichtext.text: {{otherships|HMS Duncan}} {{Use dmy dates|date=October 2012}} {{unreferenced|date=June 2008}} {|{{Infobox ship begin}} {{Infobox ship image |Ship image= |Ship caption= }} {{Infobox Ship Career |Hide header= |Ship country= |Ship flag=[[Image:Naval Ensign of the United Kingdom.svg|60px|RN Ensign]] |Ship name= HMS ''Duncan'' |Ship namesake=[[Adam Duncan, 1st Viscount Duncan|Adam Duncan]] |Ship ordered= |Ship awarded= |Ship builder=[[John I. Thornycroft & Company]] |Ship original cost= |Ship yard number= |Ship way number= |Ship laid down=17 December 1953 |Ship launched=30 May 1957 |Ship sponsor= |Ship christened= |Ship completed= |Ship acquired=October 1958 |Ship commissioned= 21 October 1958 |Ship recommissioned= |Ship decommissioned= 1984 |Ship in service= |Ship out of service= |Ship renamed= |Ship reclassified= |Ship refit= |Ship struck= |Ship reinstated= |Ship homeport= |Ship identification= |Ship motto= ''Secundis dubusque rectus''<br />("Upright in prosperity and peril") |Ship nickname= |Ship honours= |Ship honors= |Ship captured= |Ship fate= Broken up February 1985 |Ship status= |Ship notes= |Ship badge= }} {{Infobox ship characteristics |Hide header= |Header caption= |Ship class= {{sclass|Blackwood|frigate}} |Ship type= |Ship displacement= |Ship length= |Ship beam= |Ship height= |Ship draught= |Ship propulsion= |Ship speed= |Ship range= |Ship endurance= |Ship test depth= |Ship complement= |Ship sensors= |Ship EW= |Ship armament= |Ship armour= |Ship notes= }} |} '''HMS ''Duncan''''' was the fifth RN ship named after Admiral [[Adam Duncan, 1st Viscount Duncan|Adam Duncan]]. She was a {{sclass|Blackwood|frigate}} of the [[Royal Navy]] that served in the [[Cod Wars]]. ==Service== From her first commisioning in 1958 until 1965 ''Duncan'' was the leader of the Fishery Protection Squadron.She was involved in the [[First Cod War]] between [[United Kingdom]] and [[Iceland]] over [[fishing rights]], intervening between the Icelandic coastguard and British trawlers. She was an escort to [[HMY Britannia|HMY ''Britannia'']] in August 1960. In 1964 she fired the salute at the opening of the new [[Forth Road Bridge]]. She also visited [[Nantes]] in 1961 and [[Copenhagen]] in 1965. She was given the Freedom of the city of [[Kingston upon Hull|Hull]] for the part she played in the Cod Wars. In 1966 she completed an extensive modernisation at Rosyth Naval Dockyard and in the following year attended Portsmouth Navy Days.<ref>Programme, ''Navy Days Portsmouth, 26th-28th August 1967'', HMSO, p15.</ref> In 1970 she was again present at Portsmouth Navy Days, by this time she was part of the Portland Training Squadron.<ref>Programme, ''Navy Days Portsmouth, 29th-31st August 1970'', HMSO, p23.</ref> During the early 1980s, HMS ''Duncan'' served alongside {{HMS|Eastbourne|F73}} as Harbour Training Ship at Rosyth Dockyard for the Marine Engineering Artificer Apprentices from the shore base HMS ''Caledonia''. ==Commanding officers== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:left" !From||To|||Captain |- |1967||1967|||Lieutenant Commander Peter A Pinkster RN |- |1970||1970|||Lieutenant-Commander M F Nalder RN |} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==Publications== *Marriot, Leo, 1983. ''Royal Navy Frigates 1945-1983'', Ian Allen Ltd. ISBN 07110 1322 5 {{Blackwood class frigate}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Duncan (F80)}} [[Category:Blackwood-class frigates]] [[Category:1957 ships]]
